intro: Gomphostemma heyneanum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elliptical, yellowish fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora.
